intro: Silene bungei, commonly known as the Bunge's campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its erect stems and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene bungei is often found in high-altitude habitats and is adapted to cold, arid conditions.
